co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib

Class CompositeDatasetDefinition<D extends Dataset>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib.AbstractDatasetDefinition<D,DatasetAdmin>
      • co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib.CompositeDatasetDefinition<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - defines data operations that can be performed on this dataset instance
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatasetDefinition<D,DatasetAdmin>, Reconfigurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CounterTimeseriesTableDefinition, IndexedObjectStoreDefinition, IndexedTableDefinition, KeyValueTableDefinition, TimeseriesTableDefinition

    @Beta
public abstract class CompositeDatasetDefinition<D extends Dataset>
extends AbstractDatasetDefinition<D,DatasetAdmin>
implements Reconfigurable
    Handy implementation of DatasetDefinition that implements basic methods by delegating logic execution to underlying dataset definitions.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataset

        protected final <T extends Dataset> T getDataset(DatasetContext datasetContext,
                               String name,
                               DatasetSpecification spec,
                               Map<String,String> arguments,
                               ClassLoader classLoader)
                                      throws IOException
        Gets a Dataset instance from the delegates with the given instance name.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the dataset
        Parameters:
        datasetContext - the context which the get call is happening
        name - name of the dataset
        spec - the DatasetSpecification for the outer dataset
        arguments - dataset arguments
        classLoader - classloader for loading the dataset
        Returns:
        a dataset instance
        Throws:
        IOException - if failed to get a dataset instance

      • configure

        public DatasetSpecification configure(String instanceName,
                             DatasetProperties properties)
        Description copied from interface: DatasetDefinition
        Configures new instance of the dataset.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface DatasetDefinition<D extends Dataset,DatasetAdmin>
        Parameters:
        instanceName - name of the instance
        properties - instance configuration properties
        Returns:
        instance of DatasetSpecification that fully describes dataset instance. The DatasetSpecification can be used to create DatasetAdmin and Dataset to perform administrative and data operations respectively, see DatasetDefinition.getAdmin(DatasetContext, DatasetSpecification, ClassLoader) and DatasetDefinition.getDataset(DatasetContext, DatasetSpecification, Map, ClassLoader).

      • reconfigure

        public DatasetSpecification reconfigure(String instanceName,
                               DatasetProperties newProperties,
                               DatasetSpecification currentSpec)
                                 throws IncompatibleUpdateException
        Description copied from interface: Reconfigurable
        Validates the new properties, including a compatibility check with the existing spec, and returns a new dataset specification for the dataset instance.
        Specified by:
        reconfigure in interface Reconfigurable
        newProperties - the updated dataset properties, to be validated by this method
        currentSpec - the current specification of the dataset
        Returns:
        a new dataset specification, created from the new properties
        Throws:
        IncompatibleUpdateException - if the new properties are not compatible with the existing dataset

      • getAdmin

        public final DatasetAdmin getAdmin(DatasetContext datasetContext,
                    DatasetSpecification spec,
                    ClassLoader classLoader)
                            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: DatasetDefinition
        Provides dataset admin to be used to perform administrative operations on the dataset instance defined by passed DatasetSpecification.

        datasetContext - context for the dataset
        spec - specification of the dataset instance.
        classLoader - classloader to use when executing admin operations
